intro: Bouvardia capitata, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with glossy, dark green leaves. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink and red, bloom in late winter to early spring, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Bouvardia capitata is known for its ability to thrive in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil.
